instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with x on battery symbol
threads.message: got this macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that shows an x on the battery symbol. Whenever you unplug it goes into sleep mode slowly. any suggestions? could tjis be the resistors? i get 10v on <SIGNAL>PPV_BATT_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with x on battery symbol
threads.message: Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with just the charger and no battery plugged in?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with x on battery symbol
threads.message: 12.3 voltas on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with just the 85w charger and no battery plugged in

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with x on battery symbol
threads.message: This would indicate an issue on the SMBUS data lines between the ISL and the SMC. Do a diode mode reading on pin 2 of both <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with x on battery symbol
